trial_identification.studytitle: Identification of the determinants of under-vaccination of infants and children in Western Australia
trial_identification.scientifictitle: What are the determinants of under vaccination rates of infants and children in Western Australia

interventions.interventions: Parents of children under six will be asked to complete a questionnaire about their attitudes towards childhood vaccination. Only one questionnaire will be required (on the day of consent). Parents will be asked for their consent to check details of vaccination records with their child's primary healthcare provider and details of the child's inpatient medical history.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Determinants of vaccination will be assessed by the use of a parent questionnaire and review of the child's medical record at the time of questionnaire completion
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Questionnaire will be completed on one occasion only - at the time of consent

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Parents / Guardians of children under 6 years of age giving informed consent

sponsorship.primarysponsorname: Telethon Institute for Child Health Research

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The purpose of the study is to identify the key determinants of under-vaccination among infants and children in Western Australia (WA). This study will compare socio-demographic characteristics of parents of under-vaccinated compared with fully-vaccinated children, and stated beliefs/attitudes held by parents towards vaccination and toward vaccine preventable diseases. In addition, we will survey parents about perceived barriers to vaccination and potential solutions to improve confidence in or accessibility to vaccination. Through the identification of determinants of direct relevance to WA families, we expect to inform effective strategies to improve vaccine coverage in WA.
